snippet: The village of Ras Baalbek, Lebanon, is determined to stay out of the Syrian conflict, even as it is pushed toward deeper reliance on one of the combatants, Hezbollah.
abstract: Christian village of Ras Baalbek, Lebanon, is generally supportive of the presence of Hezbollah in their community, recognizing that without them town could be taken over by Islamic State militants or other insurgent groups; this support is not free of suspicions about group's Islamist ideology and future ambitions.
lead_paragraph: The village of Ras Baalbek, Lebanon, is determined to stay out of the Syrian conflict, even as it is pushed toward deeper reliance on one of the combatants, Hezbollah.

headline.main: Clashes on Syrian Border Split Lebanese Town
headline.print_headline: Clashes on Syrian Border Split Lebanese Town

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
